diff_hunk:
@@ -617,10 +617,10 @@ $ bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
 # To build with GPU support:
 $ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
 
-$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
+$ sudo bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
body:
> @@ -617,10 +617,10 @@ $ bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
>  # To build with GPU support:
>  $ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
> 
> -$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
> +$ sudo bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

In case of this, "/tmp/tensorflo_pkg" is as same as usage of other OS
platform like Ubuntu. but OS X environment   "/tmp" location of file system
is need to sudo permission. current package location occur to OS
dependency. I think that build and install from source code is not so good
specific location. If it is possible to change other description from
"/tmp/tensorflow_pkg" to other location, it is more flexible way to build
and installation.

body_html:
@@ -617,10 +617,10 @@ $ bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

To build with GPU support:

$ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

-$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
+$ sudo bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

In case of this, "/tmp/tensorflo_pkg" is as same as usage of other OS
platform like Ubuntu. but OS X environment "/tmp" location of file system
is need to sudo permission. current package location occur to OS
dependency. I think that build and install from source code is not so good
specific location. If it is possible to change other description from
"/tmp/tensorflow_pkg" to other location, it is more flexible way to build
and installation.

On Tue, Apr 26, 2016 at 8:15 AM, Martin Wicke notifications@github.com
wrote:

In tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md
#2095 (comment):

@@ -617,10 +617,10 @@ $ bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

To build with GPU support:

$ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

-$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
+$ sudo bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

You really shouldn't need sudo for this one, unless your /tmp folder isn't
writable for your user, or wherever you downloaded tensorflow to isn't.
